# Introduction

Let's explore the earthquake data with visualizations!

```{.r .cell-code}
library(knitr)

```


:::

## Load Data

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
earthquake <- readRDS("../data/processed/earthquake_clean.rds")
cat("Loaded", nrow(earthquake), "observations\n")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Loaded 142083 observations
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
top_10_states <- earthquake %>%
  count(State, sort = TRUE) %>%
  head(10) %>%
  pull(State)
```
:::


# Magnitude Analysis

## Histogram of Magnitudes

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(earthquake, aes(x = Magnitude)) +
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.5, fill = "steelblue", color = "black") +
  labs(
    title = "Distribution of Earthquake Magnitudes",
    x = "Magnitude",
    y = "Count"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 6463 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range
(`stat_bin()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](03-exploratory_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


**Observation:** Most earthquakes have magnitude around 8.

## Magnitude by State

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
earthquake %>%
  filter(State %in% top_10_states) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = State, y = Magnitude, fill = State)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(
    title = "Magnitude by State (Top 10 States)",
    x = "State",
    y = "Magnitude"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 4413 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range
(`stat_boxplot()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](03-exploratory_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Geographic Analysis

## Where are the Epicenters?

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(earthquake, aes(x = Epicenter_Lon, y = Epicenter_Lat)) +
  geom_point(aes(size = Magnitude, color = Magnitude), alpha = 0.6) +
  scale_color_gradient(low = "yellow", high = "red") +
  labs(
    title = "Earthquake Epicenter Locations",
    x = "Longitude",
    y = "Latitude"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 6463 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_point()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](03-exploratory_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


**Observation:** Epicenters are concentrated around 39.5°N, -120°W (Lake Tahoe area).

## Top Recording Locations

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
earthquake %>%
  count(Location, State) %>%
  arrange(desc(n)) %>%
  head(10) %>%
  kable(col.names = c("Location", "State", "Count"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


|Location      |State | Count|
|:-------------|:-----|-----:|
|HILO          |HI    |   728|
|VOLCANO       |HI    |   578|
|PAHALA        |HI    |   409|
|SAN FRANCISCO |CA    |   401|
|LOS ANGELES   |CA    |   378|
|ANCHORAGE     |AK    |   374|
|SAN DIEGO     |CA    |   362|
|HOLLISTER     |CA    |   353|
|ADAK          |AK    |   325|
|EUREKA        |CA    |   283|


:::
:::


## Distance Categories

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
earthquake %>%
  count(Distance_Category) %>%
  kable(col.names = c("Distance Category", "Count"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


|Distance Category | Count|
|:-----------------|-----:|
|Far               | 21107|
|Medium            | 30868|
|Near              | 44406|
|Very Far          | 45702|


:::
:::


# Intensity Analysis

## Intensity Distribution

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
earthquake %>%
  filter(!is.na(Intensity)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = factor(Intensity))) +
  geom_bar(fill = "lightblue", color = "black") +
  labs(
    title = "Earthquake Intensity Distribution",
    x = "Intensity",
    y = "Count"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](03-exploratory_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


# Time Analysis

## Earthquakes Over Time

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
earthquake %>%
  count(DateTime) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = DateTime, y = n)) +
  geom_line(color = "darkred", size = 1) +
  geom_point(color = "darkred", size = 2) +
  labs(
    title = "Earthquake Activity Over Time",
    x = "Date/Time",
    y = "Number of Events"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_line()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: Removed 1 row containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_point()`).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](03-exploratory_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


**Observation:** Most activity concentrated on December 28-29, 1948.

# Summary

Key findings from exploratory analysis:

- Most earthquakes were magnitude 8
- Epicenter located near Lake Tahoe (CA/NV border)
- Recording stations up to 300 km away
- Activity concentrated over 2 days

---
